title: 2024 Porsche 911 GT3 6-Speed
description: This 2024 Porsche 911 GT3 was purchased new by the owner and was optioned from the factory with an Arctic Gray exterior finish in addition to Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) and a six-speed manual transaxle, which is paired with a 4.0-liter flat-six. Having just over 2k miles, it is further equipped with a mechanical limited-slip differential, black leather and Race-Tex upholstery, LED headlights, a rear swan-neck-hinged wing, rear-axle steering, Satin Neodyme 20" and 21" center-locking wheels, a front-axle lift system, heated 18-way adaptive Sport Plus seats, a Bose sound system, and Porsche Communication Management. This 992 GT3 is now offered on dealer consignment with a window sticker, the owner's manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Alabama title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2024 Porsche 911 GT3 6-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #199,286.
text: This 2024 Porsche 911 GT3 was purchased new by the owner and was optioned from the factory with an Arctic Gray exterior finish in addition to Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) and a six-speed manual transaxle, which is paired with a 4.0-liter flat-six. Having just over 2k miles, it is further equipped with a mechanical limited-slip differential, black leather and Race-Tex upholstery, LED headlights, a rear swan-neck-hinged wing, rear-axle steering, Satin Neodyme 20″ and 21″ center-locking wheels, a front-axle lift system, heated 18-way adaptive Sport Plus seats, a Bose sound system, and Porsche Communication Management. This 992 GT3 is now offered on dealer consignment with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Alabama title. The car is finished in Arctic Gray and has LED headlights, a rear swan-neck-hinged wing, a rear fog light, ParkAssist rear parking sensors, a backup camera, puddle light projectors, side graphics, and dual center-exit exhaust outlets. Paint protection film and a ceramic coating have been applied to the exterior, per the seller. Satin Neodyme-finished 20″ front and 21″ rear GT3 center-lock wheels are mounted with Pirelli tires. Stopping power is provided by Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) with yellow calipers over cross-drilled and ventilated discs at each corner. The car is equipped with rear-axle steering and a front-axle lift system. The heated 18-way adaptive Sport Plus seats are trimmed in black leather with Race-Tex inserts, “GT3” embroidery on the headrests, and GT Silver stitching that extends to the center console, dashboard, door panels, and knee pads. Porsche-branded floor mats line the footwells, and additional appointments include carbon-fiber trim, Porsche Communication Management, a Bose sound system, carbon-fiber illuminated door sill guards, automatic climate control, and cruise control. The GT3 sports steering wheel features a drive-mode selector dial, and it frames a central tachometer with a 9k-rpm redline as well as a digital speed readout and dual configurable TFT screens. A dash-mounted chronograph is included as part of the Chrono package. The digital odometer indicates just over 2k miles, all of which were added under current ownership. The 4.0-liter flat-six features direct fuel injection, VarioCam variable valve timing, dry-sump lubrication, and individual throttle bodies. It was factory rated at 502 horsepower and 346 lb-ft of torque. The car is fitted with the optional extended-range 23.7-gallon fuel tank. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with a mechanical limited-slip differential. The window sticker shows initial delivery to Porsche of Huntsville in Alabama, along with factory colors, options, and a total price of $224,070. The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. Your real-time updates could not be connected. html:
This 2024 Porsche 911 GT3 was purchased new by the owner and was optioned from the factory with an Arctic Gray exterior finish in addition to Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) and a six-speed manual transaxle, which is paired with a 4.0-liter flat-six. Having just over 2k miles, it is further equipped with a mechanical limited-slip differential, black leather and Race-Tex upholstery, LED headlights, a rear swan-neck-hinged wing, rear-axle steering, Satin Neodyme 20″ and 21″ center-locking wheels, a front-axle lift system, heated 18-way adaptive Sport Plus seats, a Bose sound system, and Porsche Communication Management. This 992 GT3 is now offered on dealer consignment with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Alabama title.

The car is finished in Arctic Gray and has LED headlights, a rear swan-neck-hinged wing, a rear fog light, ParkAssist rear parking sensors, a backup camera, puddle light projectors, side graphics, and dual center-exit exhaust outlets. Paint protection film and a ceramic coating have been applied to the exterior, per the seller.

Satin Neodyme-finished 20″ front and 21″ rear GT3 center-lock wheels are mounted with Pirelli tires. Stopping power is provided by Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) with yellow calipers over cross-drilled and ventilated discs at each corner. The car is equipped with rear-axle steering and a front-axle lift system.

The heated 18-way adaptive Sport Plus seats are trimmed in black leather with Race-Tex inserts, “GT3” embroidery on the headrests, and GT Silver stitching that extends to the center console, dashboard, door panels, and knee pads. Porsche-branded floor mats line the footwells, and additional appointments include carbon-fiber trim, Porsche Communication Management, a Bose sound system, carbon-fiber illuminated door sill guards, automatic climate control, and cruise control.

The GT3 sports steering wheel features a drive-mode selector dial, and it frames a central tachometer with a 9k-rpm redline as well as a digital speed readout and dual configurable TFT screens. A dash-mounted chronograph is included as part of the Chrono package. The digital odometer indicates just over 2k miles, all of which were added under current ownership.

The 4.0-liter flat-six features direct fuel injection, VarioCam variable valve timing, dry-sump lubrication, and individual throttle bodies. It was factory rated at 502 horsepower and 346 lb-ft of torque. The car is fitted with the optional extended-range 23.7-gallon fuel tank. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with a mechanical limited-slip differential.

The window sticker shows initial delivery to Porsche of Huntsville in Alabama, along with factory colors, options, and a total price of $224,070.

The Carfax report is free of accidents or other reported damage.
